title: String interpreted as a column name when creating an index
test:
CREATE TABLE test (c0);
CREATE INDEX index_1 ON test('asdf'); -- Error: no such column: asdf

title: COLLATE nocase index on a WITHOUT ROWID table malfunctions
comment: This bug was classified as "severe" and had existed since 2013.

title: PRAGMA case_sensitive_like can corrupt some databases
comment: The failing test case caused the SQLite developers to realize "a defect in the design of SQLite, not a defect in the implementation." Seven options to address this were outlined. Since it was not very clear how to best address this, the quirk was documented in the documentation and a compile time option to omit the relevant pragma was introduced.

title: Unique index that uses GLOB does not detect duplicate due to REAL conversion
PRAGMA case_sensitive_like conflicts with LIKE operator when creating an index
Multi-row insert circumvents index check
COLLATE NOCASE index on REAL column malfunctions
UPSERT documentation issue
comment: Note that this was not a bug in the code. Rather, the documentation was not very clear on this is.

title: TYPEOF index on REAL column malfunctions
Index on REAL column malfunctions when multiplying with a string
Problem with REAL values and string functions used in indexes or on expressions
comment: As described in one of the commit messages for this fix, addressing this bug required a "big change" in the code.

title: GLOB and minus in index and real column
Incorrect result on a table scan of a partial index
comment: This issue was classified as "severe", was since 2013 in SQLite, and was a bug in the theorem prover.

title: REAL PRIMARY KEY and floating point comparison does not work
ALTER TABLE fails when renaming an INTEGER PRIMARY KEY column in a WITHOUT ROWID table
test:
CREATE TABLE t0 (c0 INTEGER, PRIMARY KEY (c0)) WITHOUT ROWID;
ALTER TABLE t0 RENAME COLUMN c0 TO c1; -- no such column: c0

title: INSERT OR FAIL inserts row although it violates a table constraint
comment: As described on the mailing list, this bug report exposed two bugs and required two different fixes.

title: Incorrect result for "<" and "<=" comparison of rowid and non-numeric text value
comment: The bug was classified as "severe" and existed in SQLite since 2013.

title: './' LIKE './' does not match
Row is not fetched with PRAGMA reverse_unordered_selects=true
Malformed database image when using a REAL PRIMARY KEY
comment: This bug was classified as "severe" and existed in SQLite since 2015.

title: Incorrect handling of Infinity by the ROUND function
test: SELECT 1e500 >= 1,  CAST(1e500 AS INT) >= CAST(1 AS INT), ROUND(1e500) >= ROUND(1); -- 1|1|0

title: Partial NOT NULL index malfunctions with IS NOT/!=
comment: This bug was classified as "critical" and was in SQLite since 2013.

title: Mixing main and temp databases in foreign keys is not supported
REINDEX causes rows not to be fetched in a WITHOUT ROWIDs table and PRIMARY KEY DESC
comment: The bug highlights a conceptual issue in SQLite and cannot be fixed without breaking backward compatibility. The issue received its own name, namely the "WITHOUT ROWID DESC PRIMARY KEY UNIQUE constraint index anomaly". Nevertheless, as stated in the bug report, it is unlikely that real-world applications are affected.

title: PRAGMA reverse_unordered_selects=true results in row not being fetched
comment: This bug was introduced while fixing another bug that I had previously found.

title: REAL rounding seems to depend on FROM clause
Malformed image when using no journal mode, zero cache size, and failing when creating an index
comment: Although this was not recognized as a bug, the bug report resulted in a documentation update and change in the default options for SQLite's defensive configuration.

title: Query results in a SEGFAULT
Index on non-existing column results in a fabricated value being fetched
comment: This bug report resulted in a change of the accepted SQL dialect, disallowing strings in double quotes when creating indexes.

title: Nested boolean formula with IN operator computes an incorrect result
comment: This bug uncovered that the compiler somtimes confuses x IS TRUE with x IS FALSE, and the other way around.

title: "Malformed database schema" when creating a failing index within a transaction
CAST('-' AS NUMERIC) computes 0.0
test: SELECT CAST('-' AS NUMERIC); -- unexpected: computes 0.0 rather than 0

title: Incorrect result when subtracting a large integer number from a TEXT value
CAST to NUMERIC no longer converts to INTEGER
TEXT value interpreted as column name in an index with empty list in an IN expression
LIKE malfunctions for INT PRIMARY KEY COLLATE NOCASE column
Illegal argument to LIKELIHOOD() does not result in error when combined with "IN ()"
CAST('.' AS NUMERIC) computes 0.0 rather than 0
test: SELECT -'.'; -- expected: 0, actual: 0.0

title: COLLATE expression has an affinity
test: SELECT ((CAST(1 as INT)) COLLATE BINARY) == '1'; -- expected: 0, actual: 1

title: Another case of Illegal argument to LIKELIHOOD() does not result in error when combined with "IN ()"
-'1.0' computes -1.0 rather than -1
test: SELECT -'1.0'; -- expected: -1, actual: -1.0

title: COLLATE expression in the right side of an IN operator results in an affinity conversion
test: SELECT (1 IN (CAST('1' as TEXT) COLLATE NOCASE)); -- expected: 0, actual: 1

title: Lossless conversion when casting a large TEXT number to NUMERIC is not performed
LIKELY(), UNLIKELY() and LIKELIHOOD() have affinities
test:
SELECT LIKELY(CAST(1 AS INT)) = '1'; -- expected: 0, actual: 1
SELECT UNLIKELY(CAST(1 AS INT)) = '1'; -- expected: 0, actual: 1
SELECT LIKELIHOOD(CAST(1 AS INT), 0.5) = '1'; -- expected: 0, actual: 1

title: IS TRUE operator malfunctions with COLLATE and REAL value
test:
SELECT 0.5 IS TRUE COLLATE NOCASE; -- expected: 1, actual: 0
SELECT 0.5 IS TRUE COLLATE RTRIM; -- expected: 1, actual: 0
SELECT 0.5 IS TRUE COLLATE BINARY; -- expected: 1, actual: 0

title: CAST('-0.0' AS NUMERIC) computes 0.0 rather than 0
test: SELECT CAST('-0.0' AS NUMERIC); -- expected: 0, unexpected: 0.0
comment: Opening this bug report also (indirectly) caused a discussion on the mailing list on how -0.0 should be printed by SQLite, with over 50 replies (see http://mailinglists.sqlite.org/cgi-bin/mailman/private/sqlite-users/2019-June/084857.html).

title: CAST takes implicit COLLATE of its operand
LIKE malfunctions for UNIQUE COLLATE NOCASE column
Built-in RTRIM collating sequence yields incorrect comparisons
comment: This problem has existing in the RTRIM collating sequence since it was first introduced in 2008.

title: REPAIR TABLE on a functional table marks it as crashed
COLLATE in BETWEEN expression is ignored
"Can't find record" error in SELECT statement 1 (MyISAM engine)
"Can't find record" error in SELECT statement 2 (HEAP engine)
Functional index seems to malfunction with UNSIGNED column
DROP PRIMARY KEY on UNIQUE PRIMARY KEY does not update information_schema.column
DROP COLUMN error on INVISIBLE UNIQUE INDEX that refers to constant expression
Applying NOT twice on an integer results in wrong result in WHERE condition
comment: We found this bug on the latest public version of MySQL. The bug report was closed, since the bug had already been fixed internally.

title: The negation of a "<=>" comparison malfunctions depending on the column's type
Row is not fetched when using a function expression that should yield TRUE
comment: The bug was fixed in 8.0.17, but not necessarily based on our bug report, since it was not referenced.

title: XOR operator returns incorrect result for strings with a floating-point number
test: SELECT FALSE XOR '0.5'; -- expected: 1, actual: 0

title: Duplicate entry for key 'PRIMARY' when querying information_schema.TABLES
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT) ENGINE = MyISAM;
select * from information_schema.TABLES; -- unexpected (when executed with multiple threads): Duplicate entry 'triggerbug21-t0' for key 'PRIMARY'

title: CHECK TABLE FOR UPGRADE crashes server (segfault)
comment: This bug report revealed a security vulnerability that was fixed in a Critical Patch Update (CVSSv3.0 Base Score: 4.9)

title: BENCHMARK() returns NULL in some cases but is documented to always return 0
test:
SELECT BENCHMARK(NULL, 1); -- expected: 0, actual: NULL
SELECT BENCHMARK(-1, 1); -- expected: 0, actual: NULL

title: Function return value with newline yields wrong result when used as a boolean
TEXT column used as boolean incorrectly evaluates to false
CAST of negative function return value to UNSIGNED malfunctions with BIGINT
IN operator issue when comparing signed column and the column cast to unsigned
AND/OR/XOR compute wrong result for small floating-point numbers in TEXT columns
The logical operators &, |, and ^ do not ignore newlines in TEXT
test:
SELECT '
1' & 1; -- expected: 1, actual: 0
SELECT '
1' | 0; -- expected: 1, actual: 0
SELECT '
1' ^ 1; -- expected: 0, actual: 1

title: Compare that uses UNSIGNED cast and function malfunctions in the MEMORY engine
Setting sort_buffer_size to a large value causes query to go out of memory
Unexpected result for IN operator and constants
test: SELECT "a" IN (0); -- expected: 0, actual: 1

title: Query involving &, <, and AND operators computes incorrect result
SET GLOBAL on rbr_exec_mode fails
test: SET GLOBAL rbr_exec_mode = STRICT; -- unexpected: ERROR 1228 (HY000): Variable 'rbr_exec_mode' is a SESSION variable and can't be used with SET GLOBAL

title: SET key_cache_* and key_buffer_* variables fails nondeterministically
test: SET GLOBAL key_cache_division_limit = 100; -- unexpected: fails nondeterministically with ERROR 1210 (HY000): Incorrect arguments to SET

title: Index makes DELETE fail with "Truncated incorrect DOUBLE value"
Non-unique functional index prevents PRIMARY KEY from being dropped
Query with GREATEST function malfunctions
VACUUM FULL results in deadlock
test: VACUUM FULL -- unexpected: ERROR: deadlock detected when executed with multiple threads

title: ALTER TABLE SET WITH OIDS fails after failed CONCURRENTLY index creation
GROUP BY and inheritance issue
SELECT results in "ERROR: index key does not match expected index column"
comment: This bug was reproduced to occur in "v11 and quite a large number of branches before that". The bug was fixed "somewhat accidentally" for v12, but backporting the relevant patch was declared to be too invasive.

title: DISCARD TEMP results in "ERROR: cache lookup failed for type 0"
ALTER TABLE results in "ERROR: could not open relation with OID 43707388"
comment: A fix for this seemed to be non-trivial and it was put on the "back burner until we have some consensus how to proceed on that".

title: VACUUM FULL results in ERROR: integer out of range
Issue with CHAR column and "column LIKE column" condition
Generated column and string concatenation issue
test: CREATE TABLE t0(c0 TEXT GENERATED ALWAYS AS (('abc' || 1)) STORED); -- unexpected: generation expression is not immutable

title: ERROR: found unexpected null value in index
comment: Tom Lane commented this find with "nifty". :-)

title: ERROR: negative bitmapset member not allowed in SELECT
comment: Later on this day, another bug report was opened on this: https://www.postgresql.org/message-id/flat/20190711150822.z7cirna2fjtrfcnu%40development#d05c216fb9f3d27e3b69520666b043c6. Although we reported the bug first, the second bug reporter, rather than us, was credited. Although we asked for a clarification on the mailing list (see https://www.postgresql.org/message-id/CA%2Bu7OA6RsonbT1S06TaO99QDL2H8zS-N2jO%3DwSuqAOJLX5yQSg%40mail.gmail.com), we did not receive any response.

title: SEGFAULT in 12beta2 release
comment: We received a response that this had already been fixed in commit 2322456.

title: Stack buffer overflow in 12beta2 release
comment: We received a response that this had already been fixed in commit 2322456.

title: SELECT with COLLATE results in segfault on trunk and 12 Beta 2
UPDATE causes segfault on trunk
BETWEEN SYMMETRIC condition results in "row is too big: ..., maximum size 8160"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 TEXT);
CREATE INDEX i0 ON t0(c0) WHERE ((FALSE BETWEEN SYMMETRIC TRUE AND (t0.c0 || t0.c0 IN (t0.c0, t0.c0, '1', t0.c0 || t0.c0, t0.c0 || t0.c0 || t0.c0))) BETWEEN SYMMETRIC TRUE AND TRUE) BETWEEN SYMMETRIC TRUE AND TRUE; -- ERROR:  row is too big: size 8440, maximum size 8160

title: REINDEX CONCURRENTLY causes ALTER TABLE to fail
CAST of STRING with newlines to SIGNED/UNSIGNED returns unexpected result
test:
SELECT CAST('\n1' AS UNSIGNED); -- expected: 1, actual: 0
-- also see the examples below:
-- SELECT CAST('\n1' AS SIGNED); -- expected: 1, actual: 0
-- SELECT CAST('\t  1' AS SIGNED); -- 1
-- SELECT CAST('\n1' AS REAL); -- 1
-- SELECT CAST('\n1' AS FLOAT); -- 1
-- SELECT CAST('\n1' AS DECIMAL); -- 1

title: DISABLE KEYS, DELAY_KEY_WRITE results in "Data truncated for functional index"
ANALYZE on parent table results in an error "tuple already updated by self"
Attribute has wrong type in ALTER TABLE
ADD CHECK fails for parent table if column used in CHECK is fully-qualified
Multiple inheritance and ALTER TABLE issue
Issue with DISTINCT and COLLATE
Query with ORDER BY results in "database disk image is malformed" error
ANALYZE causes DISTINCT to malfunction in CROSS JOIN
Query with DISTINCT does not fetch all distinct rows
MIN() malfunctions for UNIQUE column
MIN() malfunctions for a query with ISNULL condition
comment: This bug was fixed 11 years after it was introduced.

title: Unexpected affinity conversion in view
Row is not fetched in SELECT from VIEW
Unexpected affinity conversion for view column in IN operator
Incorrect result for query that uses MIN() and a CAST on rowid
Constant expression in partial index results in row not being fetched
Unexpected error in DELETE with existing trigger
Null pointer dereference caused by window functions in result-set of EXISTS(SELECT ...)
LEFT JOIN fails to fetch row
WHERE clause erroneously influences value of fetched column from view
INDEXED BY results in row not being fetched
DISTINCT malfunctions for IS NULL
Row is not fetched in table with INTEGER PRIMARY KEY
Row with comparison on TEXT UNIQUE column is not fetched
LIKELY() seems to cause unexpected affinity conversion for rowid
Unexpected affinity conversion is performed for the IN operator
Short-circuit evaluation issue
Partial index causes row to not be fetched
Partial index causes row to not be fetched in BETWEEN expression
Partial index and BETWEEN issue
REINDEX causes "UNIQUE constraint failed" error
Expression computed on row yields incorrect result
Different rounding when converting TEXT to REAL
IS NULL unexpectedly evaluates to TRUE
COLLATE NOCASE string comparison yields incorrect result
BETWEEN issue in view
DISTINCT malfunctions for VIEW
COLLATE issue in view
GLOB unexpectedly does not match
Row is not fetched when using WHERE clause with INSTR()
INSERT INTO causes segfault on trunk
comment: We reported this bug on the security mailing list where it was stated that "next week it'd have been a security issue [since a new PostgreSQL version would have been released], perhaps, but since v12 isn't formally released yet I don't think we need to treat it as one.

title: Comparison on view malfunctions
FTS integrity-check malfunctions
comment: After we reported this bug, a test case for the same bug was found using a fuzzer and reported on the SQLite mailing list

title: FTS pgsz option results in "database disk image is malformed" error
FTS rebuild in transaction causes integrity-check to fail
DROP DATABASE seems to leave behind a table when using the "tables" configuration option
Inserting the "+" and "-" strings fails
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 TIMESTAMP, c1 BINARY(1));
INSERT INTO t0(c0, c1) VALUES (0, "-");

title: The "<>" and "=" operators do not work for NCHAR columns
Unexpected result when using arithmetic expressions in WHERE clause
FTS integrity-check indicates that the database disk image is malformed
FTS rebuild in combination with crisismerge results in error "database or disk is full"
LEFT JOIN in view malfunctions
LEFT JOIN in view malfunctions with NOTNULL
FTS order=DESC results into integrity-check failing
FTS integrity-check malfunctions for transaction and the prefix option
FTS integrity_check fails when inserting x'00'
Trigger inserts duplicate value in UNIQUE column
FTS merge does not terminate
INSERT into table with two triggers does not terminate
Comparison of row values results in incorrect result
Comparison of row values results in incorrect result (incomplete fix)
Row value comparison yields incorrect result
Comparison of row values with COLLATE NOCASE yields incorrect result
Crash on REPLACE INTO of a table with an AFTER DELETE trigger
FTS integrity-check malfunctions nondeterministically with tokenize="ascii"
Trigger causes query to compute incorrect result
REINDEX causes "UNIQUE constraint failed" error for generated column
Segfault in table with generated columns
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY GENERATED ALWAYS AS(1), c1 UNIQUE GENERATED ALWAYS AS(1), c2 UNIQUE);
INSERT INTO t0 VALUES(NULL); -- Segmentation fault

title: Segfault when updating table with generated columns
VACUUM issue on table with generated column
VACUUM on table with generated column results in an error
comment: This bug report made the SQLite developers remove the PRAGMA legacy_file_format option.

title: VACUUM on table with generated column that uses TYPEOF results in an error
Segfault in table with generated column and foreign key
REPLACE causes segfault in table with generated column and foreign key
Incorrect result for GLOB operator
LEFT JOIN in view malfunctions with partial index on table
PRAGMA integrity_check fails due to CHECK constraint even without records
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 CHECK(ABS(-9223372036854775808)));
PRAGMA integrity_check; -- unexpected: integer overflow

title: Row value comparison malfunctions on view with left join
UNLIKELY in query causes row to not be fetched
REPLACE on table with generated NOT NULL column results in segfault
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 NOT NULL AS(c1), c1);
REPLACE INTO t0(c1) VALUES(NULL); -- Segmentation fault

title: NULL WHERE condition unexpectedly results in row being fetched
Segfault when inserting into table with generated columns
UPDATE on table with two generated columns and CHECK clause results in segfault
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0, c1 AS(c0 + c2), c2 AS(c1) CHECK(c2));
UPDATE t0 SET c0 = NULL; -- Segmentation fault

title: VACUUM results in "database disk image is malformed" for PRIMARY KEY with duplicate column
DISTINCT malfunctions for VIEW with virtual table
REINDEX CONCURRENTLY unexpectedly fails
test:
CREATE TEMP TABLE t0(c1 INT PRIMARY KEY) ON COMMIT DELETE ROWS;
REINDEX TABLE CONCURRENTLY t0; -- unexpected: ERROR:  index "t0_pkey_ccnew" already contains data

title: Unexpected "cache lookup failed for collation 0" failure
ALTER TABLE results in "could not find cast from 3904 to 3831"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 int4range UNIQUE, FOREIGN KEY (c0) REFERENCES t0(c0));
ALTER TABLE t0 ALTER c0 SET DATA TYPE int4range; -- ERROR:  could not find cast from 3904 to 3831

title: Failed assertion clauses != NIL
No = operator for opfamily 426
ALTER TABLE fails when changing column type due to index with bit_ops opclass
Fetching from information_schema.tables results in segfault
Incorrect result for expression with the <=> operator and IS NULL
Index causes incorrect result when comparing float-point number with INT
GREATEST() and LEAST() malfunction for NULL
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX USING HASH malfunctions for engine=Aria table
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT) engine=Aria;
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX i0 USING HASH ON t0(c0); -- Key/Index cannot be defined on a virtual generated column

title: CREATE TABLE with generated column and RLIKE results in segfault
test: CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT AS(('' RLIKE '['))); -- segfault

title: UNIQUE constraint causes a query with string comparison to omit a row in the result set
NOT NULL and UNIQUE constraints cause SUM() to yield an incorrect result
Segfault when creating constant bit_length() index on TEMP table
test:
CREATE TEMP TABLE t0(c0 int) ON COMMIT DELETE ROWS;
CREATE INDEX i0 ON t0(bit_length('')); -- Segmentation fault

title: LEFT JOIN malfunctions with partial ISNULL index
FailedAssertion("!OidIsValid(def->collOid)", File: "view.c", Line: 89)
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 TEXT COLLATE "POSIX");
CREATE VIEW v0(c0) AS (SELECT (t0.c0 COLLATE "C")::INT FROM t0); -- FailedAssertion("!OidIsValid(def->collOid)", File: "view.c", Line: 89)

title: Incorrect result for TEXT comparison on rtree table
column = NULL predicate evaluates to TRUE for rtree table
Join on two rtree tables malfunctions
Row value comparison malfunctions with rtree table
Comparison on INT column in rtree table malfunctions
Incorrect result for predicate on rtree table
NOT NULL auxiliary column in rtree table malfunctions
CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE causes segfault
test: CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE vt0 USING rtree;
comment: We reported this bug via a private email.

title: Generated column and foreign key causes a segfault
Query on table without rows and generated column results in "out of memory" error
PRAGMA integrity_check does not terminate on table with generated column
LEFT JOIN segfault on rtree table
REINDEX results in "UNIQUE constraint failed" for generated column
FTS database disk image is malformed for UTF-16 encoding after update
REINDEX segfaults on table with generated columns
LEFT JOIN malfunctions with generated column
UPDATE causes "database table is locked" for rtree table
FILTER clause in window function causes a segfault
Incorrect result for BETWEEN and generated column
FTS database disk image is malformed for UTF-16 encoding
FTS database disk image is malformed for update on languageid
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeMemAboutToChange: Assertion `(mFlags&MEM_Str)==0 || (pMem->n==pX->n && pMem->z==pX->z)' failed
Debug assertion fts5StructureRead: Assertion `p->iStructVersion!=0' failed
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `memIsValid(pRec)' failed
SELECT on window function causes a segfault
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 UNIQUE);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE(c0, 0) IN(SELECT FIRST_VALUE(0) OVER(), 0); -- Segmentation fault

title: Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `flags3==pIn3->flags' failed
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 CHECK(c1 IN(c1)), c1 INT);
INSERT INTO t0(c1) VALUES('0'); -- sqlite3.c:86300: sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `flags3==pIn3->flags' failed.

title: Debug assertion sqlite3ExprSkipCollateAndLikely: Assertion `pExpr->op==TK_COLLATE' failed
Debug assertion constructAutomaticIndex: Assertion `!ExprHasProperty(pExpr, EP_FromJoin) || pExpr->iRightJoinTable!=pSrc->iCursor || pLoop->prereq!=0' failed
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `pIn1!=pIn3' failed
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `flags3==pIn3->flags' failed (2)
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT, CHECK(CASE c0 WHEN c0 THEN 0 END));
INSERT INTO t0 VALUES('0'); -- sqlite3.c:86300: sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `flags3==pIn3->flags' failed.

title: Debug assertion sqlite3MemCompare: Assertion `pMem1->enc==pMem2->enc || pMem1->db->mallocFailed' failed
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeMemAboutToChange: Assertion `(mFlags&MEM_Str)==0 || (pMem->n==pX->n && pMem->z==pX->z)' failed (2)
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `pC!=0' failed
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 UNIQUE);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE (t0.c0, 1) IN(SELECT NTILE(1) OVER(), 0 FROM t0); -- sqlite3.c:90197: sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `pC!=0' failed.

title: Debug assertion impliesNotNullRow: Assertion `pWalker->eCode==0' failed
Debug assertion rtreeRelease: Assertion `pRtree->nNodeRef==0 || pRtree->bCorrupt' failed
FTS database disk image is malformed for special characters in table
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `pIn1!=pIn3' failed (2)
UPDATE with complex WHERE condition on rtree results in "database table is locked" error
comment: This was not considered a bug. However, to clarify, a section "Reading And Writing At The Same Time" was added to the rtree documentation.

title: Debug assertion sqlite3Fts5HashScanNext: Assertion `!sqlite3Fts5HashScanEof(p)' failed
FTS database disk image is malformed for UTF-16 encoding and integrity check
Debug assertion fts5CheckTransactionState: Assertion `iSavepoint<=p->ts.iSavepoint' failed
Debug assertion sqlite3TableColumnAffinity: Assertion `iCol<pTab->nCol' failed.
test:
CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE t0 USING rtree(c0, c1, c2);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE ((0, 0) IN (SELECT COUNT(*), LAG(5) OVER(PARTITION BY 0) FROM t0), 0) <= (t0.c1, 0); -- sqlite3.c:98053: sqlite3TableColumnAffinity: Assertion `iCol<pTab->nCol' failed.

title: Debug assertion sqlite3BtreeInsert: Assertion `pCur->curFlags & BTCF_ValidNKey' failed
Debug assertion sqlite3FinishCoding: Assertion `!pParse->isMultiWrite || sqlite3VdbeAssertMayAbort(v, pParse->mayAbort)' failed
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 PRIMARY KEY, c1, c2 UNIQUE) WITHOUT ROWID;
INSERT OR FAIL INTO t0(c2) VALUES (0), (NULL) ON CONFLICT(c2) DO UPDATE SET c1 = c0 -- sqlite3.c:108474: sqlite3FinishCoding: Assertion `!pParse->isMultiWrite || sqlite3VdbeAssertMayAbort(v, pParse->mayAbort)' failed.

title: Debug assertion assert_pager_state: Assertion `pPager->changeCountDone==0 || pPager->eLock>=RESERVED_LOCK' failed
FTS4 integrity-check results in "database disk image is malformed" for UTF-16 encoding
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `memIsValid(&aMem[pOp->p1])' failed.
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 NOT NULL DEFAULT '', c1 AS(c0) NOT NULL);
REPLACE INTO t0(c0) VALUES(NULL); -- sqlite3.c:85112: sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `memIsValid(&aMem[pOp->p1])' failed.

title: Debug assertion exprSrcCount: Assertion `0' failed
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0);
SELECT (0, 0) IN(SELECT MIN(c0), NTILE(0) OVER()) FROM t0; -- sqlite3.c:103486: exprSrcCount: Assertion `0' failed.

title: Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `memIsValid(pRec)' failed
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, c1 AS(c0) UNIQUE);
REPLACE INTO t0 VALUES(NULL); -- sqlite3.c:87334: sqlite3VdbeExec: Assertion `memIsValid(pRec)' failed.
comment: According to the SQLite developers, this bug report revealed a subtle problem n the new (unreleased) generated columns feature.

title: Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeMemAboutToChange: Assertion `(mFlags&MEM_Real)==0 || pMem->u.r==pX->u.r' failed
Trigger on normal table causes the database disk image to become malformed
NATURAL JOIN on virtual table results in "parse error in rank function"
Debug assertion codeVectorCompare: Assertion `0' failed
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 CHECK(((0, 0) > (0, c0))));
INSERT INTO t0(c0) VALUES(0) ON CONFLICT(c0) DO UPDATE SET c0 = 3; -- sqlite3.c:98717: codeVectorCompare: Assertion `0' failed.
comment: Since we reported this bug 18 minutes after it was introduced, Richard Hipp sent a post titled '18 minutes 41 seconds' to the SQLite mailing list (see https://www.sqlite.org/src/info/f481636f1a0333c6)

title: Inconsistent handling of subqueries in index expressions
Debug assertion sqlite3VdbeMemAboutToChange: Assertion `(mFlags&MEM_Real)==0 || pMem->u.r==pX->u.r' failed (2)
FTS5 integrity-check results in "database disk image is malformed" for UTF-16 encoding and SUBSTR
DBSTAT query computes incorrect result for aggregate column
test:
CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE stat USING dbstat;
SELECT * FROM stat WHERE stat.aggregate == NULL; -- unexpected: row is fetched

title: DBSTAT query computes incorrect result for name column
test:
CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE stat USING dbstat;
SELECT * FROM stat WHERE stat.name = NULL; -- unexpected: row is fetched

title: DBSTAT query computes incorrect result for stat.aggregate = 1 condition
test:
CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE stat USING dbstat;
SELECT * FROM stat WHERE stat.aggregate = 1; -- unexpected: fetches one record

title: Incorrect result for query with 0 >= t0.c0 AND t0.c0 = v0.c0 condition
Incorrect result for COUNT(), UTF16be encoding and SUBSTR
Incorrect result for LIKE query
Generated column causes query to omit a record in the result set
Crash when using VECTORIZE=experimental_on
Internal error in expression that uses a CAST and COLLATE
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE 1 > -(('1a' COLLATE en)::INT); -- internal error

title: Unexpected error when using EXPERIMENTAL SCRUB
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 STRING UNIQUE, c1 STRING COLLATE en PRIMARY KEY);
EXPERIMENTAL SCRUB TABLE t0; -- ERROR: scrub-index: unsupported comparison operator: <collatedstring{en}> IS NOT DISTINCT FROM <unknown>

title: DEFAULT value causes unexpected syntax error when executing INSERT
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 BOOL DEFAULT (NULL BETWEEN ('' COLLATE en) AND ''));
INSERT INTO t0(c0) VALUES(DEFAULT); -- ERROR: at or near "collate": syntax error

title: TO_ENGLISH(-9223372036854775808) results in an internal error
test: SELECT TO_ENGLISH(-9223372036854775808); -- internal error: runtime error: index out of range

title: Incorrect result for BETWEEN SYMMETRIC query
Internal error for BETWEEN operator and CAST to BYTES
test: SELECT '' BETWEEN ''::BYTES AND ''; -- ERROR: internal error: lookup for ComparisonExpr ((@1)[bytes] > ('')[string])[bool]'s CmpOp failed

title: Query on VIEW with OFFSET NULL and WHERE condition involving CURRENT_USER() unexpectedly fetches a row
Incorrect result for query with IS NULL condition on UNIQUE column and VECTORIZE=experimental_on
SHOW EXPERIMENTAL_FINGERPRINTS error for STRING columns and character escapes
Internal error setting tracing=true
test: SET SESSION tracing=true; -- ERROR: internal error: expected string for set tracing argument, not *tree.DBool

title: Incorrect result for IS NULL query on VIEW using SELECT DISTINCT
comment: After we reported this bug, the CockroachDB developers added additional random testing to detect similar bugs.

title: Internal error for CASE expression and VECTORIZE=experimental_on
Deadlock in SHOW TABLES
Internal error "estimated distinct count must be non-zero"
Multi-record UPSERT inserts duplicate values in PRIMARY KEY, resulting in inconsistent results
Internal error for NATURAL JOIN and VECTORIZE='experimental_on'
Server exits on query with LEFT JOIN
Internal error for ILIKE_ESCAPE and special characters
test: SELECT ILIKE_ESCAPE('a', '', ''); -- internal error: runtime error: index out of range [2] with length 1

title: Complex ORDER BY clause results in internal error with VECTORIZE=experimental_on
Internal error for SUBSTRING with negative length and VECTORIZE=experimental_on
Internal error for arithmetic operators and NULLIF
test: SELECT NULLIF(NULL, 0) + NULLIF(NULL, 0); -- internal error: could not find overload for binary expression plus

title: Internal error for query with negative LIMIT on view with negative LIMIT
Internal error for case expression involving NULLIF and VECTORIZE=experimental_on
FULL JOIN with an SUBSTRING ON clause results in an internal error
Unexpected error for aggregate functions
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
SELECT MIN(1), MAX(NULL AND true) FROM t0; -- ERROR: no builtin aggregate for MAX on [{InternalType:{Family:UnknownFamily Width:0 Precision:0 ArrayDimensions:[] Locale:0x6fcee60 VisibleType:0 ArrayElemType:<nil> TupleContents:[] TupleLabels:[] Oid:705 ArrayContents:<nil> TimePrecisionIsSet:false IntervalDurationField:<nil>}}]

title: NOT BETWEEN query on VIEW results in an internal error with VECTORIZE=experimental_on
Internal error for SUBSTRING, INT4 cast, and VECTORIZE=experimental_on
EXPERIMENTAL SCRUB TABLE results in an "overflow during Encode" error
Internal error when setting VECTORIZE = experimental_on and DEFAULT_INT_SIZE = 4
Internal error for NATURAL JOIN on INT and INT4 column for VECTORIZE=experimental_on
EXPERIMENTAL SCRUB TABLE crashes server for table with TIMESTAMP column
Internal error for VECTORIZE=experimental_on, DEFAULT_INT_SIZE=4, and aggregate query
Syntax error for multi-valued comparison and COLLATE
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 STRING COLLATE en);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE t0.c0 < SOME ('' COLLATE en, CASE WHEN true THEN NULL END); -- ERROR: at or near ")": syntax error

title: COUNT_ROWS() malfunctions for GROUP BY
EXPLAIN (VEC) SELECT results in an internal error "zero length schema unsupported"
EXPLAIN (VEC) SELECT results in an internal error "input to aggregatorBase is not an execinfra.OpNode"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
EXPLAIN (VEC) SELECT STDDEV(0) FROM t0 WHERE ('' COLLATE en)::BOOL; -- internal error: unexpected error from the vectorized runtime:

title: Incorrect result for MAX, INTERLEAVE IN PARENT, and vectorize=experimental_on
Query with negative LIMIT results in an internal error "node lookup-join with MaxCost added to the memo"
VALUES table expression malfunctions with MAX
test: SELECT MAX(t0.c0) FROM (VALUES (NULL), (NULL)) t0(c0); -- expected: {NULL}, actual: {NULL, NULL}

title: DROP DATABASE issue with TEMP tables
UPSERT causes a decoding error in collated string column
comment: https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pull/46570#pullrequestreview-381413671

title: INSERT ... DO NOTHING results in an error "UPSERT or INSERT...ON CONFLICT command cannot affect row a second time"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT UNIQUE DEFAULT 0);
INSERT INTO t0(rowid) VALUES (0), (1) ON CONFLICT (c0) DO NOTHING; -- UPSERT or INSERT...ON CONFLICT command cannot affect row a second time

title: UPSERT on table with FOREIGN KEY constraint results in an internal error "cannot convert int to type bool"
SCRUB fails for table that has a FOREIGN KEY constraint on a rowid column
NATURAL JOIN fails with "duplicate column name" on view
EXPLAIN (VEC) results in an internal error "input to aggregatorBase is not an execinfra.OpNode"
HAVING clause incorrectly evaluates to TRUE for VARIANCE(0) IS NOT NULL predicate
GROUP BY causes unexpected conversion
MAX yields unexpected result for UTF-16
Unexpected result for MIN on string that contains a null character
test:
SELECT HEX(MIN(a)) FROM (SELECT CHAR(0, 1) COLLATE NOCASE as a UNION SELECT CHAR(0, 0) as a); -- 0000
SELECT HEX(MIN(a)) FROM (SELECT CHAR(0, 0) COLLATE NOCASE as a UNION SELECT CHAR(0, 1) as a); -- 0001

title: Query with HAVING clause, DISTSQL=off, and vectorize=on results in an internal error
Double negation causes incorrect result
Incorrect result for an UNION query and a generated column
Incorrect result for query that uses an AND operator on floats
ANALYZE TABLE causes SIGSEGV on latest trunk
ANALYZE TABLE results in "analyze worker panic" with tidb_enable_fast_analyze=1
ANALYZE TABLE results in "invalid encoded key" with tidb_enable_fast_analyze=1
COLLATE causes an incorrect result in the presence of an index
Unexpected "Data truncation: %s value is out of range in '%s'" error in UNION query
Internal error for vectorize=on and multiplication of INT4 values
GROUP BY clause nondeterministically results in an incorrect result or error
A predicate column1 = -column2 incorrectly evaluates to false for 0 values
Join on tables with redundant indexes causes a server panic
NATURAL RIGHT JOIN results in an unexpected "Unknown column" error
Incorrect result for LEFT JOIN and NULL values
Query results in "baseBuiltinFunc.vecEvalString() should never be called" error
test:
CREATE VIEW v0(c0) AS SELECT NULL;
SELECT * FROM v0 WHERE (NOT (IF(v0.c0, NULL, NULL))); -- baseBuiltinFunc.vecEvalString() should never be called, please contact the TiDB team for help

title: Query with a NATURAL LEFT JOIN unexpectedly results in an error
Query with RIGHT JOIN causes a server panic
Incorrect result for query that uses an AND operator on floats
A predicate that compares 0 with -0 yields an incorrect result
Incorrect result when comparing an UNSIGNED INT with a floating-point number
BETWEEN malfunctions when comparing a string containing a newline
BETWEEN malfunctions when comparing large numbers
Incorrect result for a predicate that uses the CHAR() function
OR clause on FLOAT/DOUBLE column unexpectedly evaluates to TRUE
LIKE operator malfunctions for COLLATE 'latin1_bin'
Using a column both in a string comparison and as a boolean yields an incorrect result
A USE_INDEX_MERGE hint causes a server panic
USE_INDEX_MERGE on table with generated column causes a server crash
fast ANALYZE TABLE on INDEX PRIMARY causes an error "analyze worker panic"
USE_INDEX_MERGE results in an incorrect result for a generated column
Incorrect result when comparing a floating-point number with an integer
Comparison on FLOAT column and large value malfunctions
BETWEEN query malfunctions for special character and TEXT index
The IN operator malfunctions for floating-poing numbers
Internal error: lookup for ComparisonExpr ((@2)[float] != ('NaN')[string])[bool]'s CmpOp failed
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
SELECT * FROM t0 GROUP BY t0.c0 HAVING MIN((CASE WHEN false THEN NULL END):::FLOAT) IS NOT NAN; -- internal error: lookup for ComparisonExpr ((@2)[float] != ('NaN')[string])[bool]'s CmpOp failed

title: Unexpected syntax error for expression involving ARRAY[NULL]
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
SELECT COUNT(CASE WHEN false THEN ARRAY[NULL] END) FROM t0; -- at or near "unknown": syntax error

title: INL_MERGE_JOIN hint results in an error "Internal : Can't find a proper physical plan for this query"
SELECT on table with generated column causes a server panic
RIGHT JOIN with CONCAT_WS fails to fetch a row
INSERT IGNORE causes an incorrect result for a query on a DECIMAL column
LEFT JOIN on a view results in "runtime error: slice bounds out of range [:264] with capacity 256"
Incorrect result when comparing a FLOAT/DOUBLE UNSIGNED with a negative number
REGEXP predicate unexpectedly results in an error "No valid regexp pattern found"
CREATE STATISTICS on table with ARRAY column
CAST to INT2 yields an incorrect/inconsistent result
Comparison with (-9223372036854775808)::TIMESTAMP results in an unexpected error
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 TIMESTAMP UNIQUE);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE (-9223372036854775808)::TIMESTAMP!=t0.c0; -- ERROR: unordered spans (/Table/1208/2/{!NULL-292277026596-12-04T15:30:07.999999001Z} /Table/1208/{2/292277026596-12-04T15:30:08.000001Z-3})

title: Query with an invalid regular expression unexpectedly does not fail
Incorrect result for query on interleaved index when vectorize=on
comment: could also be found by the qp-where oracle

title: TRUNCATE on temporary table results in "unexpected value: <nil>"
SCRUB on a temporary table that has a hash-sharded index results in an error
BETWEEN computes incorrect result when comparing DECIMAL with a string
Internal error for an invalid CREATE INDEX statement
SELECT statement on table with a hash-sharded index results in an internal error
Disconnecting from server results in crash with "unexpected leftover bytes"
ORDER BY unexpectedly causes a value to be represented in E notation when VECTORIZE=on
SCRUB on a table with FLOAT PRIMARY KEY and INTERLEAVE IN PARENT index causes server to exit
CREATE INDEX results in "invalid interleave backreference" and prevents database from being dropped
Column that is used both as an INT2 and INT4 results in an internal error
A predicate NOT(NULL OR TRUE) unexpectedly evaluates to TRUE
A comparison column=column unexpectedly evaluates to TRUE for column=NULL
PRAGMA table_info provides no output
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
PRAGMA table_info('t0'); -- expected: {0|c0|INTEGER|false|NULL|false}, actual: {}

title: SIMILAR TO results in an "Unknown error -1"
test: SELECT '' SIMILAR TO ''; -- Error: Unknown error -1

title: Comparison on UNIQUE NUMERIC column causes a query to omit a row in the result set
INSERT causes an abort with "terminate called after throwing an instance of 'duckdb::InvalidTypeException'"
Comparison of two boolean columns in different tables results in an error "Not implemented: Unimplemented type for sort"
SELECT causes JDBC driver to crash
BETWEEN expression with an INTERVAL and DECIMAL cast results in an incorrect result
RIGHT JOIN with a predicate that compares two integer columns results in an "Unhandled type" error
INSERT results in an error "Not implemented: Cannot create data from this type"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 BOOLEAN, c1 INT, PRIMARY KEY(c0, c1));
INSERT INTO t0(c1, c0) VALUES (0, 0); -- Error: Not implemented: Cannot create data from this type

title: A RIGHT JOIN unexpectedly fetches rows
Query results in an error "INTERNAL: Failed to bind column reference "c0" [5.0] (bindings: [6.0])"
Creating an empty table results in a crash
test: CREATE TABLE t0();

title: LEFT JOIN on column with NULL value results in a segmentation fault
SIMILAR TO results in an incorrect result
LEFT JOIN with comparison on integer columns results in "Not implemented: Unimplemented type for nested loop join!"
Incorrect result after an INSERT violates a UNIQUE constraint
Query with a negative shift predicate yields an incorrect result
Query with comparison on boolean column results in "Invalid type: Invalid Type [BOOL]: Invalid type for index"
Query with an AND predicate, NOT and comparison yields an incorrect result
Query using the LN() function does not terminate
ROUND() evaluates to -nan
test: SELECT ROUND(0.1, 1000); -- -nan

title: Casting a large number to REAL and multiplying it with zero results in -nan
test: SELECT 1e100::real*0; -- -nan

title: The trigonometric functions can result in -nan
test: SELECT SIN(1e1000); -- -nan

title: Incorrect result for a JOIN predicate t1.c0 IN (t0.c0) and WHERE predicate t1.c0<=t0.c0
Query that uses the CONCAT() function and OR expression crashes
Query with JOIN and WHERE condition unexpectedly fetches a value not present in the table
Incorrect result for query that uses REGEXP_MATCHES()
SELECT on DATE column with a large negative value results in a "double free or corruption"
Overflow when casting from REAL to INT results in "Invalid TypeId -1"
UPDATE causes subsequent query to segfault
GROUP BY clause results in non-deterministic result
Nondeterministic clause when using an UNION query and HAVING clause
Fetching from table and view results in a crash
Incorrect result for predicate with shift on a BIGINT column
[JDBC] Special character causes the JVM to terminate with "basic_string::_M_construct null not valid"
test:
CREATE TABLE(c0 VARCHAR);
INSERT INTO t0 VALUES('?'); -- terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::logic_error'

title: Nested MAX() results in nondeterministic result or double free
Unexpected result for SUM() upon overflow
SELECT on view with text constant in ORDER BY crashes
Query with SIMILAR TO results in "Assertion `strlen(dataptr) == length' failed"
Nested CASE expression results in Assertion `other.auxiliary->type == VectorBufferType::STRING_BUFFER' failed
RIGHT JOIN results in Assertion `filter->expressions.size() == 1' failed
RIGHT JOIN with ELT() predicate returns an incorrect result
NATURAL LEFT JOIN results in incorrect result for <=> operator
Incorrect result when using SPACE() in a predicate
Incorrect result when using the empty string as a predicate in a RIGHT JOIN
Incorrect result when fetching from a view
Server panic for predicate t0.c0=9223372036854775808 when using partitions
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT) PARTITION BY HASH(c0) PARTITIONS 3;
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE t0.c0=9223372036854775808;

title: Incorrect result or run-time error after changing column type
NATURAL LEFT JOIN with a NOT predicate results in a server panic
A NOT NULL predicate unexpectedly evaluates to TRUE
Incorrect result for CAST to DATETIME
Server panic for NATURAL LEFT JOIN on partitioned table
Using the DEFAULT() function results in an ambiguous column error
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT DEFAULT 1);
SELECT t0.c0, t0.c0 FROM t0 ORDER BY DEFAULT(t0.c0); -- Column 'c0' in field list is ambiguous

title: Internal error message when using CASE in partitioned table
test: CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT) PARTITION BY HASH((CASE WHEN 0 THEN 0 ELSE c0 END )) PARTITIONS 1; -- ERROR 1105 (HY000): UnknownType: *ast.WhenClause

title: Inserting into a partitioned table results in an "Missing session variable when eval builtin" error
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT) PARTITION BY HASH((c0<CURRENT_USER())) PARTITIONS 1;
INSERT INTO t0 VALUES (0); -- Missing session variable when eval builtin

title: Incorrect result for LEFT JOIN and CASE operator
Incorrect result for SUM() and negative number
SELECT with CASE expression causes an assertion failure "Assertion `!entry.first->Equals(&expr)' failed"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
SELECT * FROM t0 GROUP BY -4.40304405E8 ORDER BY (CASE 1 WHEN 0 THEN 0 ELSE -440304405 END); -- Assertion `!entry.first->Equals(&expr)' failed.

title: REVERSE() on special character results in "Assertion `strcmp(dataptr, normalized) == 0' failed."
test: SELECT REVERSE('Sa'); --  Assertion `strcmp(dataptr, normalized) == 0' failed.

title: Incorrect result for BETWEEN query that casts column to boolean
Query using PREFIX() results in an error std::bad_alloc

CREATE TABLE t0(c0 VARCHAR);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE PREFIX(t0.c0, ''); -- Error: std::bad_alloc

title: Unexpected error "Data Too Long" when using a WHERE clause in an UPDATE
Incorrect result for LEFT JOIN AND NULLIF
Using an index twice in an index hint results in an incorrect result
UNIQUE constraint on DECIMAL/floating-point columns causes incorrect result for NULL in AND
UNIQUE constraint on boolean column results in an incorrect result in a comparison
INL_HASH_JOIN hint causes an incorrect result for a table with a generated column
CREATE TABLE with generated column unexpectedly causes a syntax error
test: CREATE TABLE t0(c0 BINARY AS (CAST(0 AS BINARY))); -- ERROR 1064 (42000): You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your TiDB version for the right syntax to use line 1 column 30 near "binary)"

title: CREATE TABLE with generated column and escaped backslash causes a syntax error
test: CREATE TABLE t0(c0 TEXT AS ('\')); -- ERROR 1064 (42000): You have an error in your SQL syntax

title: INSERT INTO with ON DUPLICATE clause results in an unexpected "Miss column" error
INSERT INTO with ON DUPLICATE clause results in an unexpected "key not exist" error
INSERT IGNORE allows NULL value in a NOT NULL generated column
Inf value in FLOAT column causes JDBC driver error
SELECT with ORDER BY results in an "inconsistent index" error
Value in generated column depends on a WHERE clause
A predicate with COLLATE 'binary' results in a server panic "invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference"
Fetching from a view with an escaped backslash results in an unexpected syntax error
test:
CREATE VIEW v0(c0) AS SELECT '\\';
SELECT * FROM v0; -- ERROR 1105 (HY000): line 1 column 10

title: Updated value in column is not visible in a SELECT

test: SELECT SUBSTRING(0, 3, 0); -- segmentation fault

title: DISTINCT malfunctions for BOOLEAN
UNION operator malfunctions in LEFT JOIN on view
Comparing a string with a boolean yields an incorrect result after UPDATE
A select with BETWEEN and VARCHAR cast results in an incorrect result
Predicate checking for an empty string yields an incorrect result
NOACCENT.NOCASE comparison with a special character results in a segmentation fault
test: SELECT '' COLLATE NOACCENT.NOCASE='';

title: A negative DATE results in a "double free or corruption" crash
test: SELECT DATE '-10000-01-01'; -- double free or corruption

title: Query with complex ORDER BY causes an incorrect rowid value
Creating an index on rowid results in an internal error "Failed to bind column reference"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
CREATE INDEX i0 ON t0(rowid, c0); -- INTERNAL: Failed to bind column reference "c0" [0.1] (bindings: [0.0])

title: Comparison with a DATE yields an incorrect result
Subtracting a large integer from a DATE results in a "double free or corruption"
test: SELECT - 41756167 + '1969-12-11 032657' ::DATE; -- double free or corruption

title: Expression with LIKE and comparison causes an assertion failure
STDDEV_POP unexpectedly does not fetch any rows
UPDATE results in crash or assertion failure
GROUP BY does not take COLLATE into account
BETWEEN with COLLATE NOACCENT.NOCASE expression results in a segfault/ASan failure
Incorrect result for MIN() on expression involving rowid
Large argument to RPAD results in std::bad_alloc
test: SELECT RPAD('a', 100000000000000000, 0); -- Error: std::bad_alloc

title: Failed ALTER COLUMN results in a "Transaction conflict" error that cannot be aborted
Query on altered table results in a segmentation fault
UPDATE on altered table results in an error "Could not find node in column segment tree"
ALTER TABLE results in an assertion failure "Assertion `expr.return_type == vector.type' failed"
DROP column results in an assertion failure unique.index < base.columns.size().
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT, c INT UNIQUE);
ALTER TABLE t0 DROP c0; -- Assertion `unique.index < base.columns.size()' failed.

title: DROP column results in an assertion failure unique.index < base.columns.size() 2
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT, c1 INT UNIQUE);
ALTER TABLE t0 DROP c1; -- Assertion `unique.index < base.columns.size()' failed.

title: ALTER TYPE with USING results in an assertion failure "types.size() > 0"
test:
CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
ALTER TABLE t0 ALTER c0 TYPE VARCHAR USING ''; -- Assertion `types.size() > 0' failed.

title: Query using LEFT() results in a segmentation fault
SELECT with RIGHT JOIN causes an assertion failure "Assertion `!finalized' failed"

CREATE TABLE t0(c0 INT);
SELECT * FROM t0 WHERE NOT NOT - C0; -- General error: "java.lang.NullPointerException" [50000-200] HY000/50000

title: Incorrect result for query and NOT (c0 != -1 AND c0) predicate
Expression NOT(c0 AND c0) unexpectedly evaluates to FALSE
Unexpected result for query that compares an integer with a string
Query with CASE operator unexpectedly results in "Column must be in the GROUP BY list" error
Query on view that uses the BETWEEN operator results in an unexpected syntax error
Query with % operator results in a ClassCastException

title: Query on view with BINARY column results in an unexpected syntax error
MERGE INTO fails with an error "Timeout trying to lock table"
Restore YEAR data type for MySQL compatibility mode
test: SELECT CAST(1 AS YEAR); -- Syntax error in SQL statement

title: Calling math functions with a string argument results in a NullPointerException
test: SELECT CEIL('a'); -- NullPointerException

title: MERGE INTO causes an unexpected syntax error
test:
CREATE TABLE T0(c0 INT AS (1), c1 INT);
MERGE INTO T0(C0) KEY(C1) VALUES (1); -- Syntax error in SQL statement "UPDATE ""PUBLIC"".""T0"" SET  WHERE[*] ""C1""=?"

title: ROUND() function runs very long
test: SELECT ROUND(1, 10000000);

title: INSERT() with NULL arguments for the original string and string to be added results in NPE
test: SELECT INSERT(NULL, 0, 0, NULL); -- NullPointerException

title: Querying a view that uses the POSITION() function results in an unexpected syntax error

test: SELECT STRINGDECODE(X'5c38'); -- StringIndexOutOfBoundsException

title: Querying view that uses LTRIM/RTRIM results in a syntax error
CREATE TABLE with a BINARY column and large size specification results in a NegativeArraySizeException

title: Unexpected result for % and '1E1'
test: SELECT 1 % '1E1'; -- expected: {1.0}, actual: {0.0}

title: Buffer overflow in duckdb::ART::IteratorNext
